tool.name: parallel assign taxonomy uclust
tool.description: Parallel taxonomy assignment using the uclust consensus taxonomy assignment
tool.command:
parallel_assign_taxonomy_uclust.py -i $input_fasta_fp -o parallel_assign_taxonomy_uclust_output #if str($id_to_taxonomy_fp) != 'None': -t $id_to_taxonomy_fp #end if
#if str($reference_seqs_fp) != 'None': -r $reference_seqs_fp #end if
#if $min_consensus_fraction: --min_consensus_fraction=$min_consensus_fraction #end if
#if $similarity: --similarity=$similarity #end if
#if $uclust_max_accepts: --uclust_max_accepts=$uclust_max_accepts #end if
#if $jobs_to_start: -O $jobs_to_start #end if
#if $retain_temp_files: -R #end if
#if $poll_directly: -T #end if
#if $suppress_polling: -W #end if
#if str($job_prefix): -X $job_prefix #end if
#if $seconds_to_sleep: -Z $seconds_to_sleep #end if ; compress_path.py -i parallel_assign_taxonomy_uclust_output -o $output_dir

param.label: -i/--input_fasta_fp: full path to fasta file containing query sequences [REQUIRED]
param.name: input_fasta_fp

param.label: -t/--id_to_taxonomy_fp: full path to id_to_taxonomy mapping file [default: /Users/lparsons/.virtualenvs/qiime/lib/python2.7/site-packages/qiime_default_reference/gg_13_8_otus/taxonomy/97_otu_taxonomy.txt]
param.name: id_to_taxonomy_fp

param.label: --min_consensus_fraction: Minimum fraction of database hits that must have a specific taxonomic assignment to assign that taxonomy to a query [default: 0.51]
param.name: min_consensus_fraction

param.label: --similarity: Minimum percent similarity to consider a database match a hit, expressed as a fraction between 0 and 1 [default: 0.9]
param.name: similarity

param.label: --uclust_max_accepts: Number of database hits to consider when making an assignment [default: 3]
param.name: uclust_max_accepts

param.label: -R/--retain_temp_files: retain temporary files after runs complete (useful for debugging) [default: False]
param.name: retain_temp_files

param.label: -T/--poll_directly: Poll directly for job completion rather than running poller as a separate job. If -T is specified this script will not return until all jobs have completed. [default: False]
param.name: poll_directly

param.label: -W/--suppress_polling: suppress polling of jobs and merging of results upon completion [default: False]
param.name: suppress_polling

param.label: -X/--job_prefix: job prefix [default: descriptive prefix + random chars]
param.name: job_prefix

param.label: -Z/--seconds_to_sleep: Number of seconds to sleep between checks for run completion when polling runs [default: 1]
param.name: seconds_to_sleep

tool.help: This script performs like the assign_taxonomy.py script, but is intended to make use of multicore/multiprocessor environments to perform analyses in parallel. Mapping of sequence identifiers to taxonomy and quality information.
